briefTitle: Quit For Life (QFL): Smoking Cessation Among Chinese Smokers Living With HIV
officialTitle: Quit For Life (QFL): Smoking Cessation Among Chinese Smokers Living With HIV

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* HIV seropositive (by being at the HIV clinic and receiving care)
* Receiving ART treatment from the clinic (by being at the HIV clinic and receiving care)
* Smokes â‰¥ 5 cigarettes per day
* Able to speak and read in Mandarin Chinese
* Self-reported anticipate to receive ART treatment from the clinic for at least 9 months
* Own a cell phone
* Be willing to set a quit date within 1 month after baseline assessment

Exclusion Criteria:

* Self-reported using other smoking cessation program or medication
* Having a serious health problem that may make them unsuitable to stay in the study

primary.measure: Number of Participants With Biochemically Verified Smoking Cessation
primary.description: Defined as not smoking during the previous 7 days, not even a puff, validated by measuring CO level (\<8ppm) in the exhaled air

secondary.measure: Number of Participants That Self Reported Smoking Cessation at 8 Weeks
secondary.description: Participants will report if they did not smoke in the previous 7 days by answering questions in an interviewer-administered questionnaire.

secondary.measure: Number of Participants That Self Reported Smoking Cessation at 12 Weeks
secondary.description: Participants will report if they did not smoke in the previous 7 days by answering questions in an interviewer-administered questionnaire.

secondary.measure: Change in Number of Cigarettes Smoked in the Previous 30 Days at 8 Weeks
secondary.description: Participants will report the number of cigarettes they smoked in the previous 30 days by answering questions in an interviewer-administered questionnaire.

secondary.measure: Change in Number of Cigarettes Smoked in the Previous 30 Days at 12 Weeks
secondary.description: Participants will report the number of cigarettes they smoked in the previous 30 days by answering questions in an interviewer-administered questionnaire.

secondary.measure: Number of Quit Attempts at 8 Weeks
secondary.description: Participants will report the number of quit attempts since the study started by answering questions in an interviewer-administered questionnaire.

secondary.measure: Number of Quit Attempts at 12 Weeks
secondary.description: Participants will report the number of quit attempts since the study started by answering questions in an interviewer-administered questionnaire.

secondary.measure: Adherence to Antiretroviral Treatments (ART) at 8 Weeks
secondary.description: ART adherence will be assessed with the investigator developed, interviewer-administered 'Adherence to HIV medicine' questionnaire. This questionnaire assesses degree of adherence to taking HIV medicine on time by selecting a number between 0 and 10, where 0 = never on time \[worse outcome\] and 10 = always on time \[best outcome\]. Higher scores are more favorable.

secondary.measure: Adherence to Antiretroviral Treatments (ART) at 12 Weeks
secondary.description: ART adherence will be assessed with the investigator developed, interviewer-administered 'Adherence to HIV medicine' questionnaire. This questionnaire assesses degree of adherence to taking HIV medicine on time by selecting a number between 0 and 10, where 0 = never on time \[worse outcome\] and 10 = always on time \[best outcome\]. Higher scores are more favorable.

secondary.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) in the Dimensions of Mobility, Self-care, Usual Activities, Pain/Discomfort, and Anxiety/Depression at 12 Weeks
secondary.description: The EuroQol- 5 Dimension (EQ-5D) will be used to assess QOL. It is a questionnaire with five dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) and a scale of 0 to 100 where 0 means the worst health and 100 means the best health the participant can imagine.

other.description: Participant satisfaction with the intervention will be assessed using an investigator-developed questionnaire
Participant satisfaction with the intervention will be assessed using an investigator-developed questionnaire
